lap.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: the upper part of your legs when you are sitting down
lap.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Shannon sat on her mother’s lap.
His hands were folded in his lap.
lap.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a single journey around a race track
lap.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Rubens Barrichello finished a lap ahead of his team-mate.
The entire team took a victory lap in front of their cheering fans.
lap.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a single journey from one end of a swimming pool to another
lap.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Every morning she swims 50 laps in the pool.
lap.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a part of a long journey
lap.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: The last lap of their journey was by ship.
lap.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: if water laps something or laps against something such as the shore or a boat, it moves against it or hits it in small waves
lap.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The tide was lapping the harbour wall.
The waves lapped gently against the rocks.
lap.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: if an animal laps water, milk etc, it drinks it by putting its tongue into it
lap.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to pass a competitor in a race who is one complete lap behind you
lap.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: Erik Gomas spun off the track when trying to lap Andrew Scott.
